dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 1568 RH: Moving Americans Privacy Protection Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Waltz (for himself and Mr. Pascrell) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means
Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
action.action-instruction: Strike out all after the enacting clause and insert the part printed in italic
For text of introduced bill, see copy of bill as introduced on March 10, 2023

form.official-title: To amend the Tariff Act of 1930 to protect personally identifiable information, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Moving Americans Privacy Protection Act.

subsection.text: Paragraph (2) of section 431(c) of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1431(c)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The information listed in paragraph (1) shall not be available for public disclosure if—

clause.text: the Secretary of the Treasury makes an affirmative finding on a shipment-by-shipment basis that disclosure is likely to pose a threat of personal injury or property damage; or
the information is exempt under the provisions of section 552(b)(1) of title 5, United States Code.

subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall ensure that any personally identifiable information, including Social Security numbers and passport numbers, is removed from any manifest signed, produced, delivered, or electronically transmitted under this section before access to the manifest is provided to the public.

subsection.text: The amendment made by subsection (a) shall take effect on the date that is 30 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

endorsement.action-desc: Reported with an amendment, committed to the Committee of the Whole House on the State of the Union, and ordered to be printed
